lines.text: The sky belongs to the stars.
What's going on?

[painting posters]
Show business, show business.

[signs look terrible]
These look like shit, even a monkey can do better then this.
Oh Yea.

[late at night Bob painting posters]
Should've kept my mouth shut.
[Last Line]

[In agony over his brother's death]
RICHIE!

Wait Ritchie, look. I understand about friendship... but I'm being honest here. Not everyone in the world gets a shot at the "brass ring." You're gonna have to ask yourself what's more important, your friends... or your music.

[Walks back to table]
My family...
This is like my high school prom.
Yeah. Except this prom puts out.
I will never let anyone get in the way of my feelings for you,ever again.
Bob! Watch it! My guitar, man!
Sorry. I didnt' know that piece of junk was so important to you.
I even sleep with it.
Look Rosie, you're not my wife. Quit being such a drag. What the shit's eating you anyway?
I'm pregnant.
Well aren't you gonna say anything?
What's there to say? It's not my first. Or my last.
Don't be such a dreamer, man.
My dreams are pure rock and roll.

[to Bob]
I am not your puta!
[Bartender shuts the T.V]
Hey, what the hell! Man I was watching that! Put that back on!
You've had enough for one afternoon, buddy.
Put it back on! That dude's my brother!
Yeah and I'm your Irish uncle.
He doesn't want a wife. He wants a love slave, one that he can kick around.
You know, my old man wasn't around when I was born.
[takes swig of vodka and grimaces]
Why should I be?
Come on Rosie, take a hit man! Put a little mota in our love life!
How could you do this to Ritchie!
To Ritchie? I did this to me, okay!
That's my Bob, always thinking of others first.
Shut your goddamn mouth!
Hey man, don't take it out on Rosie, okay.
Ritchie, you don't understand man. You don't understand a goddamn thing!
[walking Away]
What do you think, the whole fuckin' world revolves around you!
I've had one sip of beer and I have to admit it taste like piss to me. Want it?
Yeah.
[takes a sip then puts the beer down]
What's your problem man?

Old Steve. He always said you'd be somebody and I bought it, too. If that's the way Steve wanted it that's the way it was going to be. Even after he told me he wasnt my dad, once I knew the full score, I understood why he treated you just a little bit better than me. I'll just hang around for the leftovers, like a dog. That's how much i loved him. Like a goddamn dog.
Bob we don't have to talk about this right now.
Shit! No, I want to talk about this and you're gonna listen to me!
This is a crock of shit man!
Man he set you up to conquer the world and didn't leave me shit!
Nobody told you to throw your life away! I'm only sorry I didn't say something about you be drunk half the time. You did it to yourself!
Listen to you, coming in here like you own the whole goddamn country. To me you'll always be that little asshole who followed me around in the sticks.
Yeah, I followed you around man, 'cause I thought you were somebody. Then!
Bob. Where's mom's new dress?
What new dress?
The one I asked you to buy her for Christmas.
Hey, you're the asshole with all the money, why don't you buy it yourself!
Look it's Woody Woodpecker and Buzz Buzzard, Man they make cartoons here.
Look... it could be worse, you could have been Riki Zuela.
My mom reckons I'm going to be a star. And stars don't fall from the sky.
Your wife's pregnant and in the car with you?

[on phone]
She's in the car right now!

[pause]
And what kind of car do you have?

[on phone]
A Rolls Royce!
[Maniacal laughter]

[to Ritchie]
You've been laid yet? I'm serious, I know what your problem is. Sperm pressure, it's scientific.
